Masterstation

Class Receiver

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • Masterstation.Receiver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Receiver
extends java.lang.Thread
    Receiver is a class that allows to receive files sent from another computer (Ground Station) Creates a thread that allows parallel running with another programs Allows to receive multiple files and store each at a different name All communication is done through the use of sockets and server socket with specified port number Based upon example from Oracle: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/networking/datagrams/clientServer.html
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Yevgeniy Lischuk

      void connect()
      Method to open connection to start communication Starts the Receiver thread if it haven't been started before

      Method to close the socket to stop communication Ends thread by setting control variable to false Closes socket, so server socket port closes as well
